org.forgerock.openam.entitlement.rest

Class ApplicationsResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.rest.SubjectAwareResource
      • org.forgerock.openam.rest.RealmAwareResource
        • org.forgerock.openam.entitlement.rest.ApplicationsResource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.forgerock.json.resource.CollectionResourceProvider

    public class ApplicationsResource
extends RealmAwareResource
    Endpoint for the ApplicationsResource. This endpoint supports the CRUDQ operations. It uses the Jackson library and annotated wrapper classes to generate the pojos that it will store. Similarly, when reading out from the data store, we wrap the object to allow Jackson to do the serialization leg for us.

      • ApplicationsResource

        @Inject
public ApplicationsResource(@Named(value="frRest")
                                    Debug debug,
                                    ApplicationServiceFactory applicationServiceFactory,
                                    ApplicationTypeManagerWrapper appTypeManagerWrapper,
                                    ExceptionMappingHandler<EntitlementException,org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException> exceptionMappingHandler)
        Parameters:
        debug - Debug instance.
        applicationServiceFactory - Application service factory responsible for creating the application service.
        appTypeManagerWrapper - instantiable version of the static ApplicationTypeManager class. Cannot be null.
        exceptionMappingHandler - Error handler to convert EntitlementExceptions to ResourceExceptions.

      • createApplicationWrapper

        protected ApplicationWrapper createApplicationWrapper(org.forgerock.json.JsonValue jsonValue)
                                               throws EntitlementException
        Abstracts out the createApplicationWrapper method so that we can easily test this class.
        Parameters:
        jsonValue - The JsonValue to create the wrapper from
        Returns:
        An ApplicationWrapper, wrapping the Application represented by the JsonValue provided
        Throws:
        EntitlementException - If there were errors writing the application to disk

      • createApplicationWrapper

        protected ApplicationWrapper createApplicationWrapper(org.forgerock.json.JsonValue jsonValue,
                                                      Subject mySubject)
                                               throws EntitlementException
        Creates an ApplicationWrapper to hold the Application object, after having deserialized it via Jackson.
        Parameters:
        jsonValue - The JSON to deserialize
        mySubject - The subject authorizing the request
        Returns:
        An ApplicationWrapper containing an Application, null
        Throws:
        EntitlementException - If there were issues generating the application wrapper

      • createApplicationWrapper

        protected ApplicationWrapper createApplicationWrapper(Application application,
                                                      ApplicationTypeManagerWrapper type)
        Creates an ApplicationWrapper to hold the Application object.

        This method provides an abstraction to aid testing.

        Parameters:
        application - The application
        type - The application type
        Returns:
        A new ApplicationWrapper wrapping the passed application

        public org.forgerock.util.promise.Promise<org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceResponse,org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException> updateInstance(org.forgerock.services.context.Context context,
                                                                                                                                                     String resourceId,
                                                                                                                                                     org.forgerock.json.resource.UpdateRequest request)
        Updates an existing Application. The resourceId is the name of the application to update. The new Application may alter this name, but doing so will mean the original resourceId will no longer reference the new Application.

        context -
        resourceId -
